external_links.text: Health Canada's Lists of permitted food additives
external_links.context: Claims pertaining to the absence or non-addition of a food class such as "contains no preservatives" and "no preservatives added" are permitted where none of the preservatives found in Health Canada's Lists of permitted food additives have been directly added or none are present due to carry-over [199(1)(b), SFCR].

external_links.text: The Federation of American Societies for Experimental Biology
external_links.context: Consumers may believe that monosodium glutamate (M.S.G.) is the sole source of concern in food sensitivity reactions to glutamates. However, foods that are inherently high sources of free glutamates may also be of concern. The Federation of American Societies for Experimental Biology (FASEB) Footnote 1 , in its report on adverse reactions to monosodium glutamate, concluded that there is no difference in the physiological response to man-made and natural glutamates.
